medical_history.chief_complaint: Diplopia and proptosis of the left eye.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient experienced eye pain and periorbital swelling on the right side that began approximately 33 months before evaluation. Pain was constant and did not improve with ophthalmic ketotifen fumarate. By the eighth day, he had worsening symptoms including fuzzy vision, persistent proptosis, swelling, and ptosis of the right eyelid. Subsequent episodes of recurrent eye pain and periorbital swelling on the right side occurred seven months after discontinuation of prednisone, followed by worsening symptoms and multiple treatments over the next months.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Remote history of esotropia, asthma, tonsillectomy, adenoidectomy, and myringotomy. Nine months earlier, he had an episode of bilateral submandibular sialadenitis with a negative test for mumps virus.
medical_history.social_history: The patient is a college student living in the southern central United States. He reported no alcohol use, tobacco smoking, or illicit drug use.
